## If you need to contact the team

### Telephone
From the UK: 0300 003 360, select option 8
Overseas: +44 (0)203 684 2517
Find out about call charges

### Email
SRR@cica.gov.uk

### Post
Post Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority
Alexander Bain House
Atlantic Quay
15 York Street
Glasgow
G2 8JQ
United Kingdom

## What happens next
We will call you back on 07595922929 (change) within X days.

The call should take around X minutes to complete and we'll aim to call you within your preferred days and times.

## Prepare for our call
In preparation for our call it may be useful for you to have information about the following ready:

* the date and location of the crime
* the name of the police station where the crime was reported
* your crime reference number
* your GP’s name and address
* your dentist’s name and address (if you had dental treatment because of your injuries)
* details of any previous applications you’ve made to CICA
* details of your injuries
* details of any unspent criminal convictions
* details of the person who abused you
* proof of identity for you or anyone you’re responsible for, such as a birth or marriage certificate, power of attorney or deed poll

## If you need help or support
You can contact us about your enquiry on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8.

Our phone lines are open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5pm except Wednesday when they open at 10am.

For practical or emotional support visit the Victim and Witness information websites:

* England and Wales
* Scotland
